TEXT.TITLE: GEORGIA-PACIFIC <GP> DEBT UPGRADED BY S/P
TEXT.BODY: Standard and Poor's Corp said it upgraded Georgia-Pacific Corp's 1.1 billion dlrs of debt. Raised were the company's senior debt to A-minus from BBB-plus, preferred stock to BBB-plus from BBB and preliminary rating on shelf securities to A-minus from BBB-plus. S and P said the action reflected prospects for continued healthy markets over the next few years. The rating agency also said Georgia-Pacific benefitted from cost cutting and has reduced debt by 700 mln dlrs in the past five years. The company now has flexibility to pursue a strategy of increasing its presence in the paper products market. Reuter
